properties.areaDesc: Madison, IL; Clinton, IL; Bond, IL; St. Clair, IL; Washington, IL
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:39PM CST until January 11 at 7:45AM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in St Louis has extended the

* Flood Warning for Urban Areas and Small Streams in...
Clinton County in south central Illinois...
Bond County in south central Illinois...
Madison County in southwestern Illinois...
Washington County in south central Illinois...
St. Clair County in southwestern Illinois...

* Until 745 AM CST Saturday.

* At 937 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
thunderstorms with heavy rain over the area. The rain will cause
flooding. Up to three inches of rain have already fallen since
earlier today. While no rain is falling currently, heavy rainfall
is expected to move back into the region in the next couple of
hours, bringing renewed flooding.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
St. Louis, Belleville, Granite City, O'Fallon, Alton, East St.
Louis, Collinsville, Edwardsville, Godfrey, Fairview Heights,
Cahokia, Swansea, Glen Carbon, Shiloh, Wood River, Highland, Troy,
Columbia, Bethalto and Maryville.

Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible with the
next round of thunderstorms.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 21 and 52.
Interstate 55 in Illinois between exits 23 and 37.
Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 9 and 61.

This also includes Carlyle Lake Recreational Area and Horseshoe Lake
State Park.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.
